column4: Security parameters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other assets.
Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls and access points.
Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities shall be designed and implemented.
Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.

column3: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
column4: Protection against physical and environmental threats, such as natural disasters and other intentional or unintentional physical threats to infrastructure shall be designed and implemented.
Security measures for working in secure areas shall be designed and implemented.
Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clear screen rules for information processing facilities shall be defined and appropriately enforced.
Equipment shall be sited securely and protected.
Storage media shall be managed through the life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organisation's classification scheme and handling requirements.
Information processing facilities shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.
Cables carrying power, data or supporting information services shall be protected from inception, interference or damage.
Equipment shall be maintained correctly to ensure availability, integrity and confidentiality of information.

column3: Secure disposal and re-use of equipment
column4: Items of equipment containing storage media shall be verified to ensure that any sensitive data or licensed software is removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.
